docs.snippet: Oscar fans are obsessed with stats, and the Bagger and other sites are here to fill that need....
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost as much as athletes or "American Idol" fans, Oscar watchers are obsessed with stats - that 51 of the 82 best actress winners in Oscar history won for a film that was nominated for best picture, for example. This handy chart, even breaks down some more unexpected figures related to the Academy's big night - like the cost to create a little gold man ($500), the amount the average person wins in an Oscar pool ($50), the average age of the winners of best actor (44) and actress (36) and the number of streakers to interrupt the ceremony (only one, sadly).
docs.abstract: Oscar fans are obsessed with stats, and the Bagger and other sites are here to fill that need.

docs.snippet: James Cameron, the most vocal proponent of motion-capture technology, says that it doesn't inhibit acting but empowers it....

docs.abstract: James Cameron, the most vocal proponent of motion-capture technology, says that it doesn't inhibit acting but empowers it.

docs.snippet: Paul Rieckhoff, a veteran and the leader of Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America, takes issue in Newsweek with the depiction of combat practices and military culture in "The Hurt Locker."...
docs.lead_paragraph: "The Hurt Locker," which has been riding high on the strength of its many, many award wins and plaudits from intellectual bigwigs, lost a little altitude on Wednesday because of a guest article in Newsweek.
docs.abstract: Paul Rieckhoff, a veteran and the leader of Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America, takes issue in Newsweek with the depiction of combat practices and military culture in "The Hurt Locker."

docs.snippet: As this Oscar season drags on, we will do what all bloggers do when in the doldrums: turn it over to the people....
docs.lead_paragraph: "Longest Oscar season ever," one awards-watcher complained on Twitter recently, and his discontent wasn't merely hyperbole.The telecast was indeed pushed back two weeks to make room for Olympics coverage, so it doesn't just feel longer than normal. People have been making this lament to the Bagger for a while now, but since we have nothing to compare it to - this being our first Oscar season - we've kept mum.
docs.abstract: As this Oscar season drags on, we will do what all bloggers do when in the doldrums: turn it over to the people.

headline.main: What Can the Bagger Do for You?

docs.snippet: In a move that absolutely no one saw coming whatsoever, "Avatar" swept the International 3D Society's inaugural awards....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hey, so are things beginning to seem a little predictable? If you're just tuning in to awards season, maybe not - but for most prognosticators, the favorites seem clear.
docs.abstract: In a move that absolutely no one saw coming whatsoever, "Avatar" swept the International 3D Society's inaugural awards.
